intro: Gouania microcarpa var. mollis, commonly known as the silky gouania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
